member.name: M:Xpandables.Net.DependencyInjection.ServiceCollectionExtensions.XTryDecorate``2(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection)
member.summary:
Ensures that the supplied decorator is returned, wrapping the original registered , by injecting that service type into the constructor of the supplied . Multiple decorators may be applied to the same . By default, a new instance will be returned on each request (according the Transient lifestyle), independently of the lifestyle of the wrapped service.
Multiple decorators can be applied to the same service type. The order in which they are registered is the order they get applied in. This means that the decorator that gets registered first, gets applied first, which means that the next registered decorator, will wrap the first decorator, which wraps the original service type.
member.typeparam: The service type that will be wrapped by the given .
The decorator type that will be used to wrap the original service type.
member.param: The collection of services to act on.

member.name: T:Xpandables.Net.Correlation.CommandCorrelationBehavior`1
member.summary: This class allows the application author to add post/rollback event support to command control flow. The target command should implement the interface in order to activate the behavior. The class decorates the target command handler with an implementation of that adds an event (post event) to be raised after the main one in the same control flow only if there is no exception, and an event (roll back event) to be raised when exception. The target command handler class implementation should reference the interface in order to set the expected actions.
member.typeparam: Type of the command to be handled.

member.name: T:Xpandables.Net.Correlation.IBehaviorCorrelation
member.summary:
A marker interface that allows the command/query class to add correlation context event after control flow. In the class handling the query or command, you should reference the and set the and/or .
Note that will be raised at the end of the control only if there is no exception, giving you access to all data still alive on the control flow and the will only be raised when exception. The exception in that case in accessible through the .
You need to register the expected behavior using the appropriate extension method.
class implementation will be decorated with . class implementation will be decorated with .

member.summary: Defines a method signature to be used to handle post event in correlation context.
member.param: The control flow return value only for non-void method.

member.summary: Defines a method signature to be used to handler rollback event in correlation context.

member.name: T:Xpandables.Net.Correlation.ICorrelationContext
member.summary: Defines two tasks that can be used to follow process after a control flow with and on exception during the control flow with . In order to be activated, the target class should implement the interface, the target handling class should reference the current interface (to set the action) and you should register the behavior with the expected extension method .

member.name: E:Xpandables.Net.Correlation.ICorrelationContext.PostEvent
member.summary: The event that will be raised after the main one in the same control flow only if there is no exception. The event will contain the control flow "return value" for non-void method.

member.name: E:Xpandables.Net.Correlation.ICorrelationContext.RollbackEvent
member.summary: The event that will be raised after the main one when exception. The event will contain the control flow handled exception.

member.name: T:Xpandables.Net.Correlation.QueryCorrelationBehavior`2
member.summary: This class allows the application author to add post/rollback event support to query control flow. The target query should implement the interface in order to activate the behavior. The class decorates the target query handler with an implementation of that adds an event (post event) to be raised after the main one in the same control flow only if there is no exception, and an event (roll back event) to be raised when exception. The target query handler class should reference the interface in order to set the expected actions.

member.name: M:Xpandables.Net.Disposable.Dispose
member.summary: Public Implementation of Dispose according to .NET Framework Design Guidelines callable by consumers. Do not make this method virtual. A derived class should not be able to override this method.

remarks.para: This object will be cleaned up by the Dispose method. Therefore, you should call GC.SuppressFinalize to take this object off the finalization queue and prevent finalization code for this object from executing a second time.
Always use SuppressFinalize() in case a subclass of this type implements a finalizer.

member.name: M:Xpandables.Net.Disposable.DisposeAsync
member.summary: Public Implementation of DisposeAsync according to .NET Framework Design Guidelines callable by consumers. Do not make this method virtual. A derived class should not be able to override this method.

remarks.para: This object will be cleaned up by the Dispose method. Therefore, you should call GC.SuppressFinalize to take this object off the finalization queue and prevent finalization code for this object from executing a second time.
Always use SuppressFinalize() in case a subclass of this type implements a finalizer.

member.name: M:Xpandables.Net.Disposable.DisposeAsync(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Protected implementation of Dispose pattern. When overridden in derived classes, this method get called when the instance will be disposed.
member.param: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.

remarks.list:
executes in two distinct scenarios.
If equals true, the method has been called directly or indirectly by a user's code. Managed and unmanaged resources can be disposed.
If equals false, the method has been called by the runtime from inside the finalizer and you should not reference other objects. Only unmanaged resources can be disposed.

member.name: T:Xpandables.Net.EntityFramework.IBehaviorPersistence
member.summary:
A marker interface that allows the handler class implementation to use persistence data across the control flow. The behavior makes use of an implementation of in the handler class implementation to persist data at the end of the control flow only if there is no exception. In order to control the behavior, you can add the to the command/query class and reference the in the handler class implementation, to defines actions to be applied after the control flow with on success and on exception.
You need to register the expected behavior to the service collections using the appropriate extension method, register the data context using and extension method.
class implementation will be decorated with . class implementation will be decorated with .

member.name: T:Xpandables.Net.EntityFramework.IBehaviorSeed
member.summary:
A marker interface that allows the class that implements the to be seeded before use. You need to register the expected behavior using the appropriate extension method and provide an implementation for .
The class implementation will be decorated with the .

The string containing the name of the constructor, method, property, or field member to invoke. /// -or- /// An empty string ("") to invoke the default member. /// -or- /// For IDispatch members, a string representing the DispID, for example "[DispID=3]".

A bit-mask comprised of one or more System.Reflection.BindingFlags that specify how the search is conducted. The access can be one of the BindingFlags such as Public, NonPublic, Private, InvokeMethod, GetField, and so on. The type of lookup need not be specified. If the type of lookup is omitted, BindingFlags.Public | BindingFlags.Instance | BindingFlags.Static are used.

An object that defines a set of properties and enables binding, which can involve selection of an overloaded method, coercion of argument types, and invocation of a member through reflection. /// -or- /// A null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), to use the System.Type.DefaultBinder. Note that explicitly defining a System.Reflection.Binder object may be required for successfully invoking method overloads with variable arguments.
The object on which to invoke the specified member.
An array containing the arguments to pass to the member to invoke.
member.returns: Returns if invoke OK and otherwise.

member.name: T:Xpandables.Net.Localization.ILocalizationResourceProvider
member.summary: Gives access to properties resources types to be used for localization. The resource type is identified by its string type name and behave as the data annotations attributes localization.

member.name: P:Xpandables.Net.Localization.ILocalizationResourceProvider.ViewModelResourceTypes
member.summary:
Contains the collection of resource types used to add localization for application page models (razor style). Each page is associated with a resource type name that matches the following the framework name convention. if a localization file is not defined, the default data annotation behavior is used.
Example : pageName.cshtml.cs contains the pageNameModel and the localization file is named pageNameLocalization.resx.
This behavior is available for the following attributes :

member.name: M:Xpandables.Net.QrCodes.Presenter.AbstractQrCode.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Protected implementation of Dispose pattern.
member.param: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.

remarks.list:
executes in two distinct scenarios.
If equals true, the method has been called directly or indirectly by a user's code. Managed and unmanaged resources can be disposed.
If equals false, the method has been called by the runtime from inside the finalizer and you should not reference other objects. Only unmanaged resources can be disposed.

member.summary: Generates the payload for a Girocode (QR-Code with credit transfer information). Attention: When using Girocode payload, QR code must be generated with ECC level M!

member.name: M:Xpandables.Net.QrCodes.Presenter.QrCodeData.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Protected implementation of Dispose pattern.
member.param: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.

remarks.list:
executes in two distinct scenarios.
If equals true, the method has been called directly or indirectly by a user's code. Managed and unmanaged resources can be disposed.
If equals false, the method has been called by the runtime from inside the finalizer and you should not reference other objects. Only unmanaged resources can be disposed.
